tendra outputs line directives based on the tokens that are present after preprocessing. Since no such tokens are found in a.h, there is no mention of a.h in the preprocessed output. This causes some configure scripts to fail. By printing the full #include stack every time the file changes, the problem is avoided. The printing is moved into a separate function because it needs to call itself recursively.

Even when preprocessing, pragmas should be evaluated, because they affect how #if expressions are evaluated. Unfortunately, since typedefs are not read, and some pragmas refer to typedefs, this can cause syntax errors to be raised. This patch parses #pragmas during preprocessing, but temporarily disables error messages. Since the pragmas are kept in the pp output, the errors will still be raised when compiling the pp output anyway.

When a function contains declarations, these are generated in the expression objects by add_compound_stmt. Since implicit constructors don't exist in the syntax, add_compound_stmt is never called for them. When generating the constructor's definition, wrap it in a compound statement manually so that all declarations are properly generated.
Implicit constructors can contain declarations if they call an inherited constructor with default arguments.

Calculate some more types of expressions during parsing. ~0 is equal to the type's maximum value for unsigned types, or -1 for signed two's complement types. Once ~0 is known, ~x can be calculated as ~0 - x.

Additionally, allow casts and negations where the result is unsigned and the exact size is known. Conceptually, the maximum value plus one is repeatedly added to or subtracted from the result until it is in range. If unsigned int is known to be exactly 32 bits, then a positive n is replaced by (n & 0xFFFFFFFF), and a negative n is replaced by 0x100000000 - (-n & 0xFFFFFFFF). This form is used because it is something tendra already knows how to simplify.

Allow literal to prefix an expression to indicate that the expression is to be interpreted as a constant expression. This is useful for offsetof, which needs to returns a target-dependent constant expression. Without a way to force an expression as a constant, offsetof cannot be used in (for example) the definitions of enumeration constants.
literal does not become a keyword by default. It must be defined using
revdescription.programlisting: # pragma TenDRA keyword __literal for keyword literal
revdescription.para: where __literal can be any valid identifier.

Support anonymous unions as an extension in C. The code to handle these already exists in tendra, but is hidden in #if LANGUAGE_CPP blocks. Remove these #if blocks, add a new error so that use of this feature is still diagnosed in C by default. Add a pragma
to allow this feature to be enabled or disabled during compilation, and default to an error for C, and no error for C++, to preserve the existing behaviour.
